intro: Baeckea taxifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf baeckea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. It typically grows in coastal heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Baeckea taxifolia is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
